alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 6:56PM CST until February 28 at 11:08PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Duck River Near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Agricultural land and other areas near the river are extensively flooded from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd. Flood waters approach roads near the river, including Hurricane Mills Rd, Old Hwy 13 between Cedar Grove and Forks of the River Rd, Forks of the River Rd between Blue Creek Rd, Pumpkin Creek Rd, and near the Link Farm State Archaeological Area, Dyer Rd, and Tumbling Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 23.3 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM CST Thursday was 23.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.0 feet on 01/27/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 100 PM CST.
